tracks.text: A limo pulls up to a chapel.
A bride gets out of the limo.
Another limo pulls up across the street.
Another bride gets out.
She runs into a green painted church.
Our view hurries down the aisle, past the priest at the podium. Greg Kihn stares from behind a curtain behind the altar.
5 Groomsmen mingle beside the dais.
Couples argue in the pews
Greg closes the curtain and walks backstage.
He adjusts his bowtie in a mirror.
He sees a man and woman argue in the hallway.
The couple, his parents, stop and look at him and smile.
They embrace Greg, who rolls his eyes while smiling.
Children in white stand in front of an organ.
Girls in white walk down an aisle, throwing pink pedals. Bridesmaids in pink follow, carrying bouquets.
The groomsmen gesture at Greg, who stands, back to the aisle. The bridesmaids pass behind him.
The bride, face covered by a veil, approaches with a man.
The father of the bride grabs Greg and pulls him to the bride.
Greg walks arm and arm with the bride up to the altar.
He looks behind him. His parents wear handcuffs.
The handcuffs fade away. Greg looks forward, confused.
He looks back and the parents of the bride, holding hands. Their arms merge together.
He looks around nervously, and sees another couple fused at the hip via fleshy growths.
The priest talks to Greg who looks back at him.
The priest makes an O symbol, and slides a finger inside it. Greg laughs and looks around.
People laugh. Greg sweats.
The priest makes the symbol again. Greg realizes, and pulls out a ring box.
The groomsmen laugh.
Greg pulls out a ring, smiles, and slides it on the bride's finger.
He lifts the veil, and a brunette woman smiles at him.
Her face turns into a purple, melting skull.
Greg screams and steps back.
The wedding goers turn to zombies.
The zombies reach out to him. He runs away.
A giant tentacle erupts from the floor. Greg trips.
The tentacle grabs Greg and pulls him back.
He struggles as he's dragged back down the aisle.
He grabs the side of a pew, but the panel breaks off.
He strikes the tentacle with the broken panel.
A gaping worm from the floor flails, and Greg continues to strike
Greg stands up, the zombies surrounding him.
He brandishes the panel.
The zombie arms push him towards the bride.
Greg sweats, sings, and swings the panel.
He runs through a break in the crowd.
He runs up the aisle.
He slams into a door. He tries to shove it open while the zombies approach.
He breaks out.
Rice falls on him.
He and the bride run through the rice.
They get into a limo as the groomsmen smile at him.
People wave at the limo as it drives off, trailing cans behind the bumper.
We pull back, revealing that the footage is playing on a projector.
Skeletons wearing a tuxedo and wedding dress hold hands and stare at the projection.
Greg fixes his bowtie in the mirror.
He turns to look at his parents arguing.
He picks up a bottle of alcohol, looks around, then walks through a side door.
He runs through the parking lot and leaps over a wall.
He climbs into a convertible car.
The bride from the first church comes running out the door.
She throws down her bouquet and veil.
She trudges to the street and spies Greg.
He smiles. The woman looks behind her, looks at him, then smiles.
Greg pulls up in front of the bride.
She climbs in.
The champagne bottle pops. It bubbles over as he drives away.
Cut to black
